name: Copenhagen Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: I love this hotel -- I have stayed here many times but frankly the price per night has gotten astronomic! But I love the room, the bedding, the attentive service. The restaurant food is very good -- but over-priced. The location is great next to the canal but a little tough for sight-seeing during cold weather. But I do love a visit to this lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Love the Copenhagen Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very solid choice of hotel in Copenhagen. The rooms are good sized, beds are comfortable and bathrooms are decent. We had a room overlooking the river and it was a very pleasant view. It is a 10 minute walk to the Copenhagen Central train station and about a 10 minute walk into the city center. Copenhagen is a very compact and walkable city and this is a good location but not right in the city center. Breakfast was very good in the mornings and the staff are friendly and helpful. When I return to Copenhagen, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very good choice in Copenhagen

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on a work trip to southern Sweden. As you would expect, the hotel is clean, with good food. When we stayed, the Executive Lounge was closed so we had access to a conference room next to the restaurant. This was a bit bleak, but the up-side was that we had free access to the full breakfast rather than the more limited offer in the Lounge. The hotel's own parking is very limited, although there is a car-park nearby. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Good choice for central Copenhagen

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for a weekend in Copenhagen. It was our first trip to Denmark and wanted a reliable hotel to stay at, close to the train station. The reception staff was very nice and the room wax great! A room with two double beds overlooking the water, and a bathroom with a big tub. As stated by another reviewer, there is no free wi-fi in the rooms which is quite disappointing for a 5 star hotel. The Tv is charge to watch and the minibar is expensive, but I always buy local beer from a grocery and bring my computer loaded with kid's movies when I travel, so it wasn't a big deal.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a weekend in Copenhagen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location to the train station is a 5-10 minute walk toward Tivoli. Parking is 270 DKK per 24 hours (outrageous at almost $45) but is expected this close to downtown. We weren't planning on driving but ended up doing so, so we were surprised by that price.
reviews.title: What You Would Expect for a Marriott or JW Hotel
Nothing much to fault
reviews.text: We've just returned from a 3 day break in Copehagen and found the Marriott to be excellent. I booked through a 3rd party selling rooms at a discount - we booked B&B in a city-view room, but (and I know this was lucky) we got upgraded to an executive canal-view room, with exec lounge access thrown in as well. Room was spotless and well presented. Only minor niggles I can think of are the shower has a tendency to distribute water rather liberally about the bathroom and the extraction system can be heard from the room. As others say, good location for Kobnhavns H station but a wee bit of a stroll to Nyhavn for those who are not used to walking. We also ate one night in the bar and it was good as well. 9 out of 10 but it gets a 5 on TA...

Stayed here for a suprise trip in October half time, great location by the river, away from hustle of city but close walk to all attractions near by. Nice rooms, perhaps a little traditional for me as prefer modern hotels- however that is not a negative reflection. Great public areas and great view from bar area onto river.
reviews.title: Riverside location, less than 10minute walk to station and city attractions. Quiet hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy check in and out even when busy, amazing breakfast- biggest variety and volumes of food I have ever seen, very refreshing from the normal run of the mill hotel breakfast! Wow!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is very over priced, but as with all of Copenhagen nothing is cheap, so shop around when looking for something to eat, even with the cafes- although was hard to find places as didn't seem to be many places to eat in the city weirdly!
reviews.title: Location, Location..

reviews.text: Glad we stayed here :)
reviews.title: Everything you could want and more!
Overall good but charging for milk ?
reviews.text: We chose the hotel as it had a large room with two beds which was great for two friends. I was disappointed by the fact there was no free Internet in the room and was very bemused to be told I had to pay for milk even though they provide tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also amazed that they couldn't slightly alter our room service breakfast and wanted to charge an astronomical amount for what basically a switch in an order of berries and yoghurt instead of raisins and honey. Berries ..... All 3 of them with onevorder. No honey and a very small cup of tea came with the other. All in all a bit of a rip off ..... If you can wait there are plenty of amazing places to have brunch all around the city and it will be half the price !
reviews.title: NIce for a Marriott

reviews.text: Aside from that, the concierge was never really there when we went to use him and the one time we did leave a message, nothing came from it.
reviews.title: close to the central train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms and beds were a good size and it was a lovely view over the water. Some people might find it a bit far to the centre in the cold weather.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL GOOD LOCATION*****

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not a 5 star but good for a Marriott. Bit of a walk into the centre which was a challenge over a cold Easter weekend but in Summer it would be a really nice walk. Buffet breakfast was fine and we had a really nice meal in the hotel restaurant. Recommended if you are looking for somewhere cheap but comfortable to stay.
reviews.title: Avarage Marriott experience

reviews.text: This is an Excellent hotel and worth a visit whether on business or visiting Copenhagen.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is designated as 5 Star but in my mind no quite up to the mark.
reviews.title: Poor service for a so called 5 star hotel.

reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable and well equipped..
reviews.title: Not won over really...it's just OK!

reviews.text: My only gripe is that Internet Access is chargeable from your room, although anybody can come in off the street and use the free internet provided in the Lobby - Go Figure!!!
reviews.title: Service was excellent very welcoming on our first trip to Copenhagen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had booked via booking.com for 4 adults including breakfast as they had a special deal. Upon arrival we were informed that the room had been booked for two adults & two children - & breakfast was only available for two adults due to the special deal booking. After explaining the situation the receptionist agreed to honour the package we had booked. Room tidy & clean. Beds v small for 2 full sized adults to share. Strange rule about minibar charging - if item taking out for more than 20 seconds automatically charged to ur credit card. Toilet was blocked - had to keep calling reception to get it unblocked on several occasions - hopefully they will fix the problem rather than the temporary fix of using a plunger!!!
reviews.title: It was a wonderful experience of us

description: With its windows on the quaint harbor in Denmark's capital, the fully air-conditioned Copenhagen Marriott Hotel, voted as Denmark's Leading business hotel 2007, captures the charm of this fairytale city. Beyond the doors of this luxury Copenhagen hotel are our city's most beloved sights, all within a 20-minute stroll. Inside our doors, you'll find spacious guest rooms offering exquisite views, luxurious bedding with down comforters, rich linens, a desk and high-speed Internet access.
